summary: Til Death Do Us Part... - Life with Jon 10 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/sdqxfy8sLU  Ilva the Winter had always imagined her...
caption:
Til Death Do Us Part… - Life with Jon 10 (on Wattpad) https://my.w.tt/sdqxfy8sLU 

Ilva the Winter had always imagined her wedding day to be the most beautiful day of her life. And even though she loves Jon Snow more than anything else in the world, she can’t help missing the man she had planned this wedding with. But Robb Stark died on a battlefield far away from home and Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her now. Ilva can only hope that he’s proud of her and Jon now. 

*A modern Game of Thrones fanfiction with a female OC describing the wedding day and Ilva’s life with Robb and with Jon*

title: Jon Snow x Sister!Reader Part 2!!
body:
Request: (Dialogue Prompt) “I miss moments like this more than anything.”

A/N: It’s finally here! I’ve finally got around to my most requested piece! And so I decided after reaching 100 followers, I would finally do a Part Two! Thank you so much, everyone, for all of your support! This wouldn’t be possible without you! This request was from an Anon who used a random dialogue prompt generator, and if you want to inbox me a prompt, too, just click the link down below!

Prompts: http://writingexercises.co.uk/dialogue-generator.php

Jon Snow x Sister!Reader Part One: https://itsgameofthronesimagines.tumblr.com/post/182202392731/jon-snow-x-sisterreader 

~~~~~~~~~

What’s been only hours felt like days. What’s been only days felt like months. The Night King predicted that the living armies would be unforgiving and so he had half of his army wait beyond the Wall. So when there appeared to be signs of stopping, when Daenerys believed they have won, there would be a second wave of the undead arriving in the next day or so. The Night King waited for this window when the living would be worn out and cut down to size. Now that the living had defeated his first wave of the dead, Bran could finally see what his true plan was all along.

“It was a trap. A diversion. He has a second wave of the dead coming this way. They will be here tomorrow morning. He wanted to wait for us to grow tired before he sent the rest of his army out to us.”

It appeared that all was lost. Everyone stood around the war table with defeat in their eyes. Daenerys slumped back in her chair, exhausted and draining of hope. When she bothered to spare a glance in your direction, you didn’t so much as blink. You had been sitting in the same chair, staring into the fireplace for hours now, never moving, never responding to anything her family said to her.

Daenerys couldn’t convince you to fight anymore. You have already given up. You had already spent hours out in the empty battlefields, trying to cling onto hope… trying, and failing to find your brother.

But there was no sign of Jon. Every part of you knew that your twin was gone, along with the part of you that kept the two of you bonded, connected in both mind and soul. Your heart told you Jon was dead, and you felt the rest of your body shut down and die with him.

Daenerys reached over and took your hand in hers, but neither did you hold her back or even look up from the fireplace. You became unresponsive and unmoving, practically dead to the world yourself. Even though your family mourns for Jon, they tried pressing on so that maybe they could survive another war. 

Daenerys tried to listen as a tearstained Sansa and a broken down Arya tried to come up with a battle strategy. Both Stark sisters were trying to be strong and strike hope back into everyone’s hearts. They came up with a plan to have the newly won Greyjoy fleet bring the remaining of the North’s women and children under ten years of age to Essos while they finished the war. Everyone knew they couldn’t bring the women and children south where Cersei would be waiting, so this was the only option.

“If anything happens,” Daenerys looks towards Yara and Theon, both looking smaller and broken since they defeated their uncle, “If Winterfell falls, take the woman and children to Meereen instead for a more permanent home. Tell Daario Naharis of the Second Sons that Daenerys Stormborn sent you.”

“But don’t go until you’ve received word from Westeros that the Dead have won,” Sansa added, “Wait for a raven to come if we–”

“When,” Arya corrected.

“When we win. So that you know when to travel back.”

The plan seemed simple enough and the Lords of the North appeared to have hope in winning this war again, even without their King in the North.

~~~~~~~~~

The next day had to be the longest day of your entire life. Too weak to go back out there fighting, Daenerys had you remain in Winterfell with her, Tyrion, and Sansa. The Mother of Dragons herself had injured her arm from flying on top of Drogon during their last battle, so the Queen was grounded and her dragons were flying aimlessly in the air, trying to desperately take down Verserion without their mother to guide them. 

Everyone was beyond the walls of the keep, fighting to their last breath and dying with the great honor of protecting their home. Or that’s what they believed. You knew it would be a fruitless death. Without Jon, this war was pointless.

“Your Grace!”

Daenerys sighed in relief to see her oldest friend, Jorah Mormont, still alive from the battle. He came back to give her a report and his smile was wider than she has ever seen in the years she’s known him.

“There’s wonderful news, Khaleesi! Word is spreading throughout the battlefield. The dead are withering and Jon Snow is among the fighting ranks again!”

“What?” Sansa gasped when words failed both you and Daenerys.

“How is that possible?” Tyrion exclaimed.

“He’s terribly wounded, but alive! I saw him out there! Beyond the hill!”

“Y/n?” Sansa questioned when she noticed you racing down the stairs off the wall, her heart now screaming to stop you, “Y/N! Where are you going?? Come back! Y/n, please! You’ll die out there! Come back!”

But you refused, taking two steps at a time and throwing off your fur cloak before running to the nearest horse. Swinging your leg over, you jump onto the steed’s back and grip the reins. You only spare a glance at your family, locking violet eyes with Daenerys before harshly kicking the horse’s sides and galloping out of the front gates of Winterfell.

When you disappeared into the fight, Daenerys shouting orders at Jorah to send men out to follow you. During the chaos, Tyrion noticed Sansa in the corner of his eye. He watched as she walked down the stairs, watching the front gates with fear in her eyes. As she reached the ground, she knelt down to take your fur cloak from the mud. Wiping off the muck, her hands started to shake while staring down at the Stark symbol she embroidered into the leather.

~~~~~~~~~

Meanwhile, you were racing through the battlefield without a second glance. Your horse stomped over anything in its path while your eyes frantically searched for the familiar mop of thick, curly, entangled dark hair.

Coming up to the growing hill of bodies and blood, you could see, far out in the distance a group of men fighting the dead back to back, never letting the circle break. If one man fell, they would quickly burn the body and fill in the hole. Squinting your eyes, heart pounding in your ears, you could see one man being dragged away from the circle by a white walker, but quickly cuts it down and shatters it to pieces with their Valyrian steel sword.

“JOOON!” You called out to him, your voice croaking after not talking for so long.

He only spared a glance when he heard his sister’s voice scream out his name, eyes widening before he started fighting harder against the dead so he could try to run to you.

You kick your horse’s sides again, willing the beast to run even faster, seeing more of Jon’s features now that you were drawing closer. He heaved his sword over his head, clearly exhausted and barely able to swing his weapon. He fought and fought until his arms grew tired and heavy, then he dropped his sword somewhere and started using his fists in slow, excruciatingly painful swings. 

Looking up again, he sees how close you are now and simply pushes a skeleton out of his way to get to you.

“Come on!” You encourage with a desperate look in your eye, reaching out with your arm and your horse draws closer.

Jon trudges forward, tripping on a few bodies before pushing himself up again, reaching out with his arm.

Time slows down, your breath and heartbeat were all you could hear in your ears, stretching your arm out so much you felt as though your shoulder would pop.

Before you could blink, you felt Jon’s arm grab yours and with all your might, you scream in pain and pull him up onto your horse in one swift movement. Once he was placed on the saddle behind you, you turn your horse around and race back towards Winterfell.

You hear Jon groan behind you, and without even looking, you knew he was in bad shape. You practically broke your horse into making it run faster towards the keep, praying you would make it in time.

Your heart almost stops beating when you see the front gate slowly starting to close in the distance, and you lean forward to try and get your horse to gallop faster.

“Y/n…” Jon groaned in pain, “We won’t make it.”

“We’ll make it,” you snap, shouting at your horse when it staggered to catch its breath.

The gate was still closing, faster than you liked to see. You want to scream at them to hold the gates opened, but you knew they wouldn’t hear you, not in time at least. You were so close now you could see what was beyond the gate. You could see the courtyard and the wounded being tended to. You could see Sansa’s hair.

You could breathe a sigh of relief as your horse just makes into the crack of the front gates. You made it.

But your horse collapsed at its knees. Exhausted and possibly half dead, your horse gave in and fell into the ground of the courtyard, causing you and Jon to tumble off and crash into the mud. You screamed out when you landed on your arm, clutching it in pain while trying to breathe again. You were certain your arm and a few ribs were broken. 

Despite your pain, you began to crawl towards Jon, faintly hearing your sister scream in the background. People were gathering all around, trying to help you stand but your swipe them away, just wanting to reach your brother. You slap your hand onto him once you get to him, pulling yourself to sit up and rolling him onto his back, sighing in relief that he was still breathing, “Jon.”

“Hey…” he grumbled, coughing on what could only be blood while trying to smile, his hand reaching up and grabbing your uninjured one, “We made it. You were right.”

“Did you ever doubt me?” You laugh slightly as Daenerys races over, kneeling on the other side of Jon and taking his other hand, crying in relief that the two of you were okay.

Now that you had time, you finally look down to inspect Jon’s wounds, and you felt the blood eave your face at the sight. He had an arrow broken off in his hip and guts were almost spilling out of his stomach. He was covered in grime from head to toe, a big gash lying just over his eye. How could he have possibly still been fighting out there half dead like this?!

“SOMEONE GET SAMWELL TARLY!” You screamed out the order, “TELL HIM HIS KING IS WOUNDED!”

“Y/n, stop,” Jon whispered, “Listen to me…”

“Someone, just grab a maester!” You kept ordering around at the people standing about to watch the scene, “Anyone! PLEASE! Save him!”

“Listen to me, Y/n,” Jon coughed out more sternly this time, causing you to look back down with tears running down your face,

“We’ll find someone, Jon. Don’t worry. You’ll be alright…”

He tried to smile, his lips quivering as he tried to breathe, “Not this time.”

Your lip quivered as well, but it was more so from trying to hold back your sobs as your broken hand trailed over his hair, “I went out there to save you…”

“You did. You saved me from dying out there, among the bodies of my friends and enemies. You saved me from dying on the bloodsoaked ground. You saved me so that I may die surrounded by my family, here in Winterfell.”

He coughs again, this time looking around to see Sansa now kneeling by his head, stroking his hair with you while she silently cried. He could see a part of Bran’s wheelchair somewhere behind his sister, but couldn’t see his brother’s face. He looks over at Daenerys and smiles, his fingers trailing over her cheek in an attempt to wipe her tears away. He wished Arya was here with them, but she was most likely still out there, fighting what remained of the Dead army, “Send word to Arya. Tell her to kill the Night King. Kill the Night King and the rest of the army will fall. It’s a task I only trust her to do so.”

Sansa nods for Daenerys, breath shaking while trying to hold in her cries, “We’ll win, Jon. I promise.”

He smiles before looking up at the sky, blinking slowly before letting out a huge sigh. When he opened his eyes again, they were distant, far away in another world as he croaked out, “Y/n…”

You lean over more to catch his gaze, trying to smile, “I’m right here.”

“I miss moments like this more than anything…”

“Like what, Jon?”

“You and me. It felt like it was just us for a long time. We couldn’t sit at the table among the rest of the Starks. We had to sit alone, together, on the other far side of the room where Catelyn couldn’t see us. Do you… do you think if she had known about our mother… would she have loved us like her own?”

You sniff back your tears and nod, “I have no doubt in my mind we would have known what a mother’s love would have been like.”

His smile was wider this time, and you saw something you haven’t seen in years. You saw a younger Jon Snow, with no scars and no horrors behind his eyes. For a moment, he looked like the young Jon Snow before he left for the Night’s Watch.

“Y/n, there you are,” he muttered, his voice sounded different and more… joyful. It brought you to confusion until he spoke again, shattering any pieces of your heart that was left, “I had a dream, dear sister. I dreamt I joined the Night’s Watch and became Lord Commander. I dreamt about becoming King in the North. The very best, it made our father proud. I dreamt about dragons and direwolves and silver-haired queens. I dreamt about a long night and six years where I couldn’t see you or the rest of our siblings. It was terrible.”

You shush him, gripping his hand even tighter, “It was just a dream, brother.”

He smiled before closing his eyes… never to open them again.

~~~~~~~~~

Please don’t forget to like, reblog, and follow! If you want to request a drabble, self-ship, OTP, one-shots, or even have theories or questions, just leave me one in my inbox! It’s always opened! And don’t be afraid to ask about my personal life or my opinion on the show ;)

He could see a part of Bran’s wheelchair somewhere behind his sister, but couldn’t see his brother’s face. He looks over at Daenerys and smiles, his fingers trailing over her cheek in an attempt to wipe her tears away. He wished Arya was here with them, but she was most likely still out there, fighting what remained of the Dead army, “Send word to Arya. Tell her to kill the Night King. Kill the Night King and the rest of the army will fall. It’s a task I only trust her to do so.”

Sansa nods for Daenerys, breath shaking while trying to hold in her cries, “We’ll win, Jon. I promise.”

He smiles before looking up at the sky, blinking slowly before letting out a huge sigh. When he opened his eyes again, they were distant, far away in another world as he croaked out, “Y/n…”

You lean over more to catch his gaze, trying to smile, “I’m right here.”

“I miss moments like this more than anything…”

“Like what, Jon?”

“You and me. It felt like it was just us for a long time. We couldn’t sit at the table among the rest of the Starks. We had to sit alone, together, on the other far side of the room where Catelyn couldn’t see us. Do you… do you think if she had known about our mother… would she have loved us like her own?”

You sniff back your tears and nod, “I have no doubt in my mind we would have known what a mother’s love would have been like.”

His smile was wider this time, and you saw something you haven’t seen in years. You saw a younger Jon Snow, with no scars and no horrors behind his eyes. For a moment, he looked like the young Jon Snow before he left for the Night’s Watch.

It brought you to confusion until he spoke again, shattering any pieces of your heart that was left, “I had a dream, dear sister. I dreamt I joined the Night’s Watch and became Lord Commander. Request: (Dialogue Prompt) “I miss moments like this more than anything.”

A/N: It’s finally here! I’ve finally got around to my most requested piece! And so I decided after reaching 100 followers, I would finally do a Part Two! Thank you so much, everyone, for all of your support! This wouldn’t be possible without you! This request was from an Anon who used a random dialogue prompt generator, and if you want to inbox me a prompt, too, just click the link down below!

Prompts: http://writingexercises.co.uk/dialogue-generator.php

Jon Snow x Sister!Reader Part One: https://itsgameofthronesimagines.tumblr.com/post/182202392731/jon-snow-x-sisterreader 

~~~~~~~~~

What’s been only hours felt like days. What’s been only days felt like months. The Night King predicted that the living armies would be unforgiving and so he had half of his army wait beyond the Wall. So when there appeared to be signs of stopping, when Daenerys believed they have won, there would be a second wave of the undead arriving in the next day or so. The Night King waited for this window when the living would be worn out and cut down to size. Now that the living had defeated his first wave of the dead, Bran could finally see what his true plan was all along.

“It was a trap. A diversion. He has a second wave of the dead coming this way. They will be here tomorrow morning. He wanted to wait for us to grow tired before he sent the rest of his army out to us.”

It appeared that all was lost. Everyone stood around the war table with defeat in their eyes. Daenerys slumped back in her chair, exhausted and draining of hope. When she bothered to spare a glance in your direction, you didn’t so much as blink. You had been sitting in the same chair, staring into the fireplace for hours now, never moving, never responding to anything her family said to her.

Daenerys couldn’t convince you to fight anymore. You have already given up. You had already spent hours out in the empty battlefields, trying to cling onto hope… trying, and failing to find your brother.

But there was no sign of Jon. Every part of you knew that your twin was gone, along with the part of you that kept the two of you bonded, connected in both mind and soul. Your heart told you Jon was dead, and you felt the rest of your body shut down and die with him.

Daenerys reached over and took your hand in hers, but neither did you hold her back or even look up from the fireplace. You became unresponsive and unmoving, practically dead to the world yourself. Even though your family mourns for Jon, they tried pressing on so that maybe they could survive another war. 

Daenerys tried to listen as a tearstained Sansa and a broken down Arya tried to come up with a battle strategy. Both Stark sisters were trying to be strong and strike hope back into everyone’s hearts. They came up with a plan to have the newly won Greyjoy fleet bring the remaining of the North’s women and children under ten years of age to Essos while they finished the war. Everyone knew they couldn’t bring the women and children south where Cersei would be waiting, so this was the only option.

“If anything happens,” Daenerys looks towards Yara and Theon, both looking smaller and broken since they defeated their uncle, “If Winterfell falls, take the woman and children to Meereen instead for a more permanent home. Tell Daario Naharis of the Second Sons that Daenerys Stormborn sent you.”

“But don’t go until you’ve received word from Westeros that the Dead have won,” Sansa added, “Wait for a raven to come if we–”

“When,” Arya corrected.

“When we win. So that you know when to travel back.”

The plan seemed simple enough and the Lords of the North appeared to have hope in winning this war again, even without their King in the North.

~~~~~~~~~

The next day had to be the longest day of your entire life. Too weak to go back out there fighting, Daenerys had you remain in Winterfell with her, Tyrion, and Sansa. The Mother of Dragons herself had injured her arm from flying on top of Drogon during their last battle, so the Queen was grounded and her dragons were flying aimlessly in the air, trying to desperately take down Verserion without their mother to guide them. 

Everyone was beyond the walls of the keep, fighting to their last breath and dying with the great honor of protecting their home. Or that’s what they believed. You knew it would be a fruitless death. Without Jon, this war was pointless.

“Your Grace!”

Daenerys sighed in relief to see her oldest friend, Jorah Mormont, still alive from the battle. He came back to give her a report and his smile was wider than she has ever seen in the years she’s known him.

“There’s wonderful news, Khaleesi! Word is spreading throughout the battlefield. The dead are withering and Jon Snow is among the fighting ranks again!”

“What?” Sansa gasped when words failed both you and Daenerys.

“How is that possible?” Tyrion exclaimed.

“He’s terribly wounded, but alive! I saw him out there! Beyond the hill!”

“Y/n?” Sansa questioned when she noticed you racing down the stairs off the wall, her heart now screaming to stop you, “Y/N! Where are you going?? Come back! Y/n, please! You’ll die out there! Come back!”

But you refused, taking two steps at a time and throwing off your fur cloak before running to the nearest horse. Swinging your leg over, you jump onto the steed’s back and grip the reins. You only spare a glance at your family, locking violet eyes with Daenerys before harshly kicking the horse’s sides and galloping out of the front gates of Winterfell.

When you disappeared into the fight, Daenerys shouting orders at Jorah to send men out to follow you. During the chaos, Tyrion noticed Sansa in the corner of his eye. He watched as she walked down the stairs, watching the front gates with fear in her eyes. As she reached the ground, she knelt down to take your fur cloak from the mud. Wiping off the muck, her hands started to shake while staring down at the Stark symbol she embroidered into the leather.

~~~~~~~~~

Meanwhile, you were racing through the battlefield without a second glance. Your horse stomped over anything in its path while your eyes frantically searched for the familiar mop of thick, curly, entangled dark hair.

Coming up to the growing hill of bodies and blood, you could see, far out in the distance a group of men fighting the dead back to back, never letting the circle break. If one man fell, they would quickly burn the body and fill in the hole. Squinting your eyes, heart pounding in your ears, you could see one man being dragged away from the circle by a white walker, but quickly cuts it down and shatters it to pieces with their Valyrian steel sword.

“JOOON!” You called out to him, your voice croaking after not talking for so long.

He only spared a glance when he heard his sister’s voice scream out his name, eyes widening before he started fighting harder against the dead so he could try to run to you.

You kick your horse’s sides again, willing the beast to run even faster, seeing more of Jon’s features now that you were drawing closer. He heaved his sword over his head, clearly exhausted and barely able to swing his weapon. He fought and fought until his arms grew tired and heavy, then he dropped his sword somewhere and started using his fists in slow, excruciatingly painful swings. 

Looking up again, he sees how close you are now and simply pushes a skeleton out of his way to get to you.

“Come on!” You encourage with a desperate look in your eye, reaching out with your arm and your horse draws closer.

Jon trudges forward, tripping on a few bodies before pushing himself up again, reaching out with his arm.

Time slows down, your breath and heartbeat were all you could hear in your ears, stretching your arm out so much you felt as though your shoulder would pop.

Before you could blink, you felt Jon’s arm grab yours and with all your might, you scream in pain and pull him up onto your horse in one swift movement. Once he was placed on the saddle behind you, you turn your horse around and race back towards Winterfell.

You hear Jon groan behind you, and without even looking, you knew he was in bad shape. You practically broke your horse into making it run faster towards the keep, praying you would make it in time.

Your heart almost stops beating when you see the front gate slowly starting to close in the distance, and you lean forward to try and get your horse to gallop faster.

“Y/n…” Jon groaned in pain, “We won’t make it.”

“We’ll make it,” you snap, shouting at your horse when it staggered to catch its breath.

The gate was still closing, faster than you liked to see. You want to scream at them to hold the gates opened, but you knew they wouldn’t hear you, not in time at least. You were so close now you could see what was beyond the gate. You could see the courtyard and the wounded being tended to. You could see Sansa’s hair.

You could breathe a sigh of relief as your horse just makes into the crack of the front gates. You made it.

But your horse collapsed at its knees. Exhausted and possibly half dead, your horse gave in and fell into the ground of the courtyard, causing you and Jon to tumble off and crash into the mud. You screamed out when you landed on your arm, clutching it in pain while trying to breathe again. You were certain your arm and a few ribs were broken. 

Despite your pain, you began to crawl towards Jon, faintly hearing your sister scream in the background. People were gathering all around, trying to help you stand but your swipe them away, just wanting to reach your brother. You slap your hand onto him once you get to him, pulling yourself to sit up and rolling him onto his back, sighing in relief that he was still breathing, “Jon.”

“Hey…” he grumbled, coughing on what could only be blood while trying to smile, his hand reaching up and grabbing your uninjured one, “We made it. You were right.”

“Did you ever doubt me?” You laugh slightly as Daenerys races over, kneeling on the other side of Jon and taking his other hand, crying in relief that the two of you were okay.

Now that you had time, you finally look down to inspect Jon’s wounds, and you felt the blood eave your face at the sight. He had an arrow broken off in his hip and guts were almost spilling out of his stomach. He was covered in grime from head to toe, a big gash lying just over his eye. How could he have possibly still been fighting out there half dead like this?!

“SOMEONE GET SAMWELL TARLY!” You screamed out the order, “TELL HIM HIS KING IS WOUNDED!”

“Y/n, stop,” Jon whispered, “Listen to me…”

“Someone, just grab a maester!” You kept ordering around at the people standing about to watch the scene, “Anyone! PLEASE! Save him!”

“Listen to me, Y/n,” Jon coughed out more sternly this time, causing you to look back down with tears running down your face,

“We’ll find someone, Jon. Don’t worry. You’ll be alright…”

He tried to smile, his lips quivering as he tried to breathe, “Not this time.”

Your lip quivered as well, but it was more so from trying to hold back your sobs as your broken hand trailed over his hair, “I went out there to save you…”

“You did. You saved me from dying out there, among the bodies of my friends and enemies. You saved me from dying on the bloodsoaked ground. You saved me so that I may die surrounded by my family, here in Winterfell.”

He coughs again, this time looking around to see Sansa now kneeling by his head, stroking his hair with you while she silently cried. He could see a part of Bran’s wheelchair somewhere behind his sister, but couldn’t see his brother’s face. He looks over at Daenerys and smiles, his fingers trailing over her cheek in an attempt to wipe her tears away. He wished Arya was here with them, but she was most likely still out there, fighting what remained of the Dead army, “Send word to Arya. Tell her to kill the Night King. Kill the Night King and the rest of the army will fall. It’s a task I only trust her to do so.”

Sansa nods for Daenerys, breath shaking while trying to hold in her cries, “We’ll win, Jon. I promise.”

He smiles before looking up at the sky, blinking slowly before letting out a huge sigh. When he opened his eyes again, they were distant, far away in another world as he croaked out, “Y/n…”

You lean over more to catch his gaze, trying to smile, “I’m right here.”

“I miss moments like this more than anything…”

“Like what, Jon?”

“You and me. It felt like it was just us for a long time. We couldn’t sit at the table among the rest of the Starks. We had to sit alone, together, on the other far side of the room where Catelyn couldn’t see us. Do you… do you think if she had known about our mother… would she have loved us like her own?”

You sniff back your tears and nod, “I have no doubt in my mind we would have known what a mother’s love would have been like.”

His smile was wider this time, and you saw something you haven’t seen in years. You saw a younger Jon Snow, with no scars and no horrors behind his eyes. For a moment, he looked like the young Jon Snow before he left for the Night’s Watch.

“Y/n, there you are,” he muttered, his voice sounded different and more… joyful. It brought you to confusion until he spoke again, shattering any pieces of your heart that was left, “I had a dream, dear sister. I dreamt I joined the Night’s Watch and became Lord Commander. I dreamt about becoming King in the North. The very best, it made our father proud. I dreamt about dragons and direwolves and silver-haired queens. I dreamt about a long night and six years where I couldn’t see you or the rest of our siblings. It was terrible.”

You shush him, gripping his hand even tighter, “It was just a dream, brother.”

He smiled before closing his eyes… never to open them again.

~~~~~~~~~

feathers that look like Myranda wove them into her dark curls remind...
caption:
The blood under their sharp fingernails and the seal brown feathers that look like Myranda wove them into her dark curls remind her of that, and of the darker nights that she wants to forget so very badly. But the sun is already rising behind the mountains, its pale golden fingers caressing the dusty glass of the wide windows, and the night will end soon enough.

summary: Will Howland Reed’s Secrets Change the Course of ‘Game of Thrones’?
title: Will Howland Reed’s Secrets Change the Course of ‘Game of Thrones’?
excerpt: Meera and Jojen’s father has barely been on the show, but in Season 8, Ned’s former pal could reveal crucial information to more than one character
description:
We’ve only seen Howland Reed once – and that was in a flashback (courtesy of Bran Stark) at the Tower of Joy where Jon Snow was born. Howland is the only known living eyewitness to Jon Snow’s true identity. If Jon is skeptical of Bran’s Three-Eyed Raven omniscience and of Samwell Tarly’s research, only Howland can remove lingering doubts from his mind about his parentage.

The nature of the Reed keep, Greywater Watch, makes it impossible to find. And its lord has been reticent even through the turmoil which has engulfed The North for the past few years. If there is anyone who is able make contact with Howland Reed it may be Bran Stark with his superpowers.

summary: I am thinking of writing a new Jonsa fanfic and need cheerleaders!
title: I am thinking of writing a new Jonsa fanfic and need cheerleaders!
body:
Just… Idk guys, I don’t wanna write it in a bubble and I want to discuss and brainstorm things. Like, nothing heavy, just an occassional “OMG I AM WRITING THEM SNOGGING AND I CANT EVEN WITH THE CUTE” text at 2 am.

The story is gonna be Fifty Shades of Grey, but done right. No iffy consent, possessive, controlling, jealous behavior, no stalking or any of that bullshit. Good BDSM (with informed enthusiastic consent) and loads of aftercare.

Who’s in? Be a bonus if you’ve read that thing or else I am going to have to read it again and I barely finished the first book the first time around.

summary:
Sansa KNOWS!!!!!
sansa was asked by littlefinger 
Why aren’t you happy? What do you want that you do not have?“
and she didn’t...
body:
Sansa KNOWS!!!!!

sansa was asked by littlefinger 

Why aren’t you happy? What do you want that you do not have?“

and she didn’t answer, that question was intentionally left unanswered because the writers  wanted us the audience to think about it  they wanted littlefinger to think about it and they mostly wanted sansa to think about it and figure out why she wans’t happy when she had everything she wanted ( she had her home back brienne and an entire army to protect her )  they wanted her to answer  that question because she was the right and the only person  that could answer  that question  !! 

Sansa loves being in jon’s presence, she loves the fact that she feels safe enough to express her emotions without fear of being ridiculed or shamed she loves the fact that he can put a smile on her face she loves the fact that  even if he doesn’t agree with her he still listens to what she has to say,his presence brought her that physical and emotional safety she never had with the men in her life except for her father and brothers.

 Even though jon is everything sansa wishes her husband were(brave,protective, loving, caring,supportive … ) before her conversation with littlefinger she didn’t want to think about jon as anything else than her brother since she couldn’t have him but her exchange with littlefinger made her think about it /her life and made her realized that she wasn’t really satisfied with her life and she wanted more than what she had and that  “the more “ was her brother  .

 Then we had the departure scene…a scene that is everything but brotherly [ jon who doesn’t know if he’s ever going to see  his beautifull sister again  turned around to look at her for what could be the last time and he gave her that l don’t want to go and leave you look ,that goodbye scene lasted 9 seconds 9 seconds of them looking longingly at each other that’s a lot in movies/shows universe that’s Fucking long that scene was so Shakespearean  so angsty and the first thing that comes to my mind when l look at jon is a french slang expression that says “il peut dead pour elle” meaning he would die for her !! man l’m crying that’s literally my boy sorry l couldn’t help it l had to point that out ] anyway..let’s get back to sansa!! 

with her sadness sitting heavy in her chest sansa stared back at jon  with that l don’t want you to go don’t leave me face on she couldn’t say it out loud but everything in her screamed l need you stay with me  

 that face this look… this is not how a sister looks at her brother but how

 a woman who is secretly in love  looks at the object of her desire leaving her;

 And then whe have littlefinger who was  a few minutes before this scene threathened and almost strangled to death by jon because he mentioned his love for sansa witnessing an unusual  scene between two brothers ( jon and sansa in their world staring silently into each other’s eyes for a long moment and acting as if the world around them stopped for a moment and she/he was the only person he/she could see  ).

[ The writers decided to make this the last shot of that scene for a reason littlefinger had a question and an unanswered one and judging by the reaction he had that scene almost answered that question !! ]

All littlefinger could think about when he looked at Sansa who was still standing on the balcony several minutes after jon departure was this  “When boys and girls live in the same home, awkward situations can arise. Sometimes, I’ve heard, even brothers and sisters develop certain affections…"﻿ .This scene right here is the reason he used dany and jon possible marriage to tease sansa and confirm the suspicion he had !!

[  also why was sansa still standing there a few minutes after jon departure looking like a woman who’s expecting to see the man she loves have a last minute change of heart or a woman who regrets not saying something to her secret lover if she wasn’t aware of her feelings ] Sansa had  men other than jon in her life her father, robb, bran, theon, joffrey, littlefinger, tyrion, crushes… so l’m pretty sure  

she knows what brotherly love is and what being  in love/attracted  to someone  feels like !!  

l personnally think that love feels like a high that demands a fix you find yourself doing things you never thought you would( in this case commit incest ) because you’re addicted to that person( drug).

You can try to keep yourself occupied or busy but when you’re in love nothing could suffice but seeing “the person you love”  talking , thinking, or listening to other people talking about that person can help and that’s exactly what sansa did the entire season 7 “ l wish jon were here” “ "I know how happy he was to see me( really!!!!) When he sees you, his heart will probably stop”  the way she smiles and the light in her eyes every time jon is around or when she talks about him speak volume SHE KNOWS!!!

Jon departure changed everything the fear/possibilty of not seeing him ever again or losing him to another woman  made it impossible for her to keep lying  to herself and forced her to admit to herself that what she needs, what she  secretly wants more than anything else and do not have is that man… the one that always puts her first, the man who’s always trying to please her the only man who made a promise to her and kept it , the man she does not want to lose,the man she wants to protect , the man she wants by her side, the man she loves….and  that man is jon her brother .

Sansa KNOWS!!!!!

sansa was asked by littlefinger 

Why aren’t you happy? What do you want that you do not have?“

and she didn’t answer, that question was intentionally left unanswered because the writers  wanted us the audience to think about it  they wanted littlefinger to think about it and they mostly wanted sansa to think about it and figure out why she wans’t happy when she had everything she wanted ( she had her home back brienne and an entire army to protect her )  they wanted her to answer  that question because she was the right and the only person  that could answer  that question  !! 

Sansa loves being in jon’s presence, she loves the fact that she feels safe enough to express her emotions without fear of being ridiculed or shamed she loves the fact that he can put a smile on her face she loves the fact that  even if he doesn’t agree with her he still listens to what she has to say,his presence brought her that physical and emotional safety she never had with the men in her life except for her father and brothers.

 Even though jon is everything sansa wishes her husband were(brave,protective, loving, caring,supportive … ) before her conversation with littlefinger she didn’t want to think about jon as anything else than her brother since she couldn’t have him but her exchange with littlefinger made her think about it /her life and made her realized that she wasn’t really satisfied with her life and she wanted more than what she had and that  “the more “ was her brother  .

 Then we had the departure scene…a scene that is everything but brotherly [ jon who doesn’t know if he’s ever going to see  his beautifull sister again  turned around to look at her for what could be the last time and he gave her that l don’t want to go and leave you look ,that goodbye scene lasted 9 seconds 9 seconds of them looking longingly at each other that’s a lot in movies/shows universe that’s Fucking long that scene was so Shakespearean  so angsty and the first thing that comes to my mind when l look at jon is a french slang expression that says “il peut dead pour elle” meaning he would die for her !! man l’m crying that’s literally my boy sorry l couldn’t help it l had to point that out ] anyway..let’s get back to sansa!! 

with her sadness sitting heavy in her chest sansa stared back at jon  with that l don’t want you to go don’t leave me face on she couldn’t say it out loud but everything in her screamed l need you stay with me  

 that face this look… this is not how a sister looks at her brother but how

 a woman who is secretly in love  looks at the object of her desire leaving her;

 And then whe have littlefinger who was  a few minutes before this scene threathened and almost strangled to death by jon because he mentioned his love for sansa witnessing an unusual  scene between two brothers ( jon and sansa in their world staring silently into each other’s eyes for a long moment and acting as if the world around them stopped for a moment and she/he was the only person he/she could see  ).

[ The writers decided to make this the last shot of that scene for a reason littlefinger had a question and an unanswered one and judging by the reaction he had that scene almost answered that question !! ]

All littlefinger could think about when he looked at Sansa who was still standing on the balcony several minutes after jon departure was this  “When boys and girls live in the same home, awkward situations can arise. Sometimes, I’ve heard, even brothers and sisters develop certain affections…"﻿ .This scene right here is the reason he used dany and jon possible marriage to tease sansa and confirm the suspicion he had !!

[  also why was sansa still standing there a few minutes after jon departure looking like a woman who’s expecting to see the man she loves have a last minute change of heart or a woman who regrets not saying something to her secret lover if she wasn’t aware of her feelings ] Sansa had  men other than jon in her life her father, robb, bran, theon, joffrey, littlefinger, tyrion, crushes… so l’m pretty sure  

she knows what brotherly love is and what being  in love/attracted  to someone  feels like !!  

l personnally think that love feels like a high that demands a fix you find yourself doing things you never thought you would( in this case commit incest ) because you’re addicted to that person( drug).

You can try to keep yourself occupied or busy but when you’re in love nothing could suffice but seeing “the person you love”  talking , thinking, or listening to other people talking about that person can help and that’s exactly what sansa did the entire season 7 “ l wish jon were here” “ "I know how happy he was to see me( really!!!!) When he sees you, his heart will probably stop”  the way she smiles and the light in her eyes every time jon is around or when she talks about him speak volume SHE KNOWS!!!

Jon departure changed everything the fear/possibilty of not seeing him ever again or losing him to another woman  made it impossible for her to keep lying  to herself and forced her to admit to herself that what she needs, what she  secretly wants more than anything else and do not have is that man… the one that always puts her first, the man who’s always trying to please her the only man who made a promise to her and kept it , the man she does not want to lose,the man she wants to protect , the man she wants by her side, the man she loves….and  that man is jon her brother .
